p: Linkage to care is sub-optimal. Linkage to HIV care is estimated at 55% from facility-based provider-initiated testing [ 20], at 60% from facility-based self-initiated testing [ 20] [ 21] and 53% from community-based mobile services [ 22]. No known published linkage to care data exists at stand-alone services. While community-based services can diagnose HIV and TB among individuals who typically do not access public health facilities [ 9], there exists limited data around linkage to HIV care and TB treatment from integrated community-based HTS.
